title: Configuration schema for the utility finding Steam App IDs from game names of the "Steam App ID Finder".
description: Validates configuration input for "gameNames" mode of the "Steam App ID Finder" script.

$schema.description: The JSON schema to use for the configuration file.

mode.description: The mode in which the script should run. Choose from any of the supported modes listed.

oneOf.title: In this mode, the script takes a list of game names as input and tries to match them to the correct Steam App IDs. This is done by first searching for complete matches, and then using string similarity for the remaining games.

inputFile.description: The file to read the game names from.

fileName.description: The name of the file to read the game names from.

fileType.description: The file type of the input file. Choose from any of the supported file types listed.

delimiter.description: The delimiter between game names when reading the game names from the input file.

onlyFullMatches.description: Whether to only get Steam App IDs for full matches or also for partial matches. If set to false, partial matches will be saved to a different output file.

partialMatchThreshold.description: The threshold for partial matches. This means that the most similar game name must have a similarity score of at least this threshold to be added to the output. The threshold must be between 0 and 1. Use 0 to get a match for every game and 1 to only get full matches. If the value is omitted, a match will be found for every game.
